meanings.definition: The act of studying or writing late at night.
meanings.sent1: Her lucubrations on the ancient civilization kept her up late into the night.
meanings.sent2: I found his lucubrations on the subject quite insightful.
meanings.sent3: After hours of lucubrations, she finally understood the complex theory.
meanings.sent4: His lucubrations under the dim light of the lamp seemed to illuminate the room.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of her lucubrations was evident from the stack of books around her.

meanings.definition: Thoughts or writings produced during late-night study or writing sessions.
meanings.sent1: The author's lucubrations often led to brilliant ideas for his novels.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed reading her lucubrations on various philosophical topics.
meanings.sent3: His lucubrations on the topic were so detailed, they could rival a textbook.
meanings.sent4: The poet's lucubrations were like stars shining in the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lucubrations were so profound that they inspired his students.
